BiblioData.Title: SILVER MICROPARTICLE- CONTAINING COMPOSITION, PROCESS FOR PRODUCTION OF THE COMPOSITION, PROCESS FOR PRODUCTION OF THE SILVER MICROPARTICLE, AND PASTE CONTAINING THE SILVER MICROPARTICLE
BiblioData.Abstract: A composition containing fine silver particles which have a uniform particle size, can form a fine drawing pattern, and have a small environmental impact, a method for producing that composition, a method for producing fine silver particles, and a paste having fine silver particles are provided. The fine silver particles are produced by carrying out a fluid preparation step of preparing a reduction fluid, a silver reaction step, and a filtration/washing step. The reaction step is carried out by adding an aqueous silver nitrate fluid to a reduction fluid whose temperature has been increased to a range between 40 and 80 DEG C. The aqueous silver nitrate fluid is added at a stretch. The composition containing fine silver particles is produced by dispersing the composition containing the fine silver particles in a polar fluid.

Claims.P: 1. A composition containing fine silver particles,comprising silver particles which are covered in a linear fatty acid having six or less carbon atoms.
2. The composition containing fine silver particles as claimed in claim 1,wherein the linear fatty acid is hexanoic acid.
3. The composition containing fine silver particles as claimed in claim 1 or 2, wherein the composition is dispersed in a polar solvent.
4. The composition containing fine silver particles as claimed in claim 3,wherein the polar solvent is water and/or terpineol.
5. A method for producing fine silver particles, the method comprising:
a step of making a fluid, a reduction fluid containing water, ammonia water, hexanoic acid, and an aqueous fluid of hydrazine hydrate;
a step of reaction, an aqueous silver nitrate fluid adding into the reduction fluid; a step of filtration/washing, recovering a product of the silver reaction step and washing the product with water.

6. The method for producing fine silver particles as claimed in claim 5, wherein the silver reaction step is a step of adding the aqueous silver nitrate fluid to the reduction fluid a temperature of which has been increased to a range between 40[deg.]C and 80[deg.]C.
7. The method for producing fine silver particles as claimed in claim 5 or 6, wherein the silver reaction step is a step of adding the aqueous silver nitrate fluid to be added at a stretch.
8. A method for producing a composition containing fine silver particles, the method comprising:
a step of making a fluid, a reduction fluid containing water, ammonia water, hexanoic acid, and an aqueous fluid of hydrazine hydrate;
a step of reaction, an aqueous silver nitrate fluid adding into the reduction fluid;
a step of filtration/washing, recovering a product of the silver reaction step and washing the product with water; and
a step of dispersing, the fine silver particles is dispersed into a polar solvent.

9. The method for producing a composition containing fine silver particles as claimed in claim 8, wherein the silver reaction step is a step of adding the aqueous silver nitrate fluid to the reduction fluid a temperature of which has been increased to a range between 40[deg.]C and 80[deg.]C.

10. The method for producing a composition containing fine silver particles as claimed in claim 8 or 9, wherein the silver reaction step is a step of adding the aqueous silver nitrate fluid to be added at a stretch.
11. A paste having fine silver particles included in the composition containing fine silver particles according to any one of claims 1 to 3.
12. The composition containing fine silver particles according to any one of claims 1 to 4, wherein a primary particle average size measured from TEM observation is in a range of 1 to 100 nm.

13. The composition containing fine silver particles according to claim 12, wherein an average particle size measured by Coulter method when a dispersion formed from 20 parts by mass of SDBS and 0.9 parts by mass of the fine silver particles in a dry state with respect to 100 parts by mass of pure water is subjected to a 1 hour ultrasonic treatment is less than 5 [micro]m.

14. The composition containing fine silver particles according to claim 12 or 13, wherein, when passes through filter-paper having a retaining particle size of 1 [micro]m, a percentage ratio of particle mass survived on the filter paper represented by (survived particle mass/particle mass included in dispersion) is less than 10 mass%.
